item.title: Urgent property flood risk: Drain has been tarmaced over and needs urgent reinstatement, 3rd November
item.description:
Drains outside drive to 64 Church Street. Latest heavy rain has caused extreme road flooding and flood water to flow over the pavement and flood driveways of a number of properties on Church street. Current excess traffic due to A40 closure is also creating waves of water which is being pushed towards the properties. Photographs show the original 2 drains which are also on your highways map. There are 4 drains in this area of Church street of which I believe only 2 are functioning as one of the drains was originally reported and advised as collapsed. I do not believe this has been fixed. Urgent surveying and assessment of these drains and further up towards the Merryfellow pub are required especially in light of the A40 traffic volumes and imminent danger of property flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Church Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Shared footpath / cyclepath covered in leaves, 3rd November
item.description:
There is an excess of wet and slippery leaves covering the path from Sainsburys up and on to the bridge over the dual carriageway. They are a potential slip hazard to both pedestrians and cyclists and they need clearing up properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnett Way, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
